text: Anyone else currently getting a 500 error on batch contact create?

Hi everyone, I am trying to automate list registration to workflows, my question is, is there a way to register lists to workflows via API? Right now, I can get users from the list and enroll them one by one in the workflow. but there are many requests, I would like to make a request to register the whole list in a workflow
Hi everyone, quick question.. is the `vid` property in the v1 API's contact object the same value as the `id` property in the v3 API's contact object?

Hi All, I have added a new card as part of our integration, it is all great apart from I have a requirement for an action (or button), to redirect to my application not open an Iframe.  I placed a link in the main result array which works a treat, but I want a button/action which does exactly the same thing, but instead of jumping to a specific record, it presents another screen which is per client not record.
Is there a way to resequence CRM Card Properties without doing something like deleting/re-adding them all?

This is more of a WordPress web dev question than a HubSpot API question. I would advise taking it up for WordPress for a PHP Hello World, then work on the HubSpot part later after that. Unless I missed something here?
Custom Contact property is probably the easiest way. For webhook, it only tells you the obj basics. You have to back-call HubSpot API to get the obj properties.

Unfortunately you are hosed

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Getting-deal-owner-phone-number-using-API/td-p/232760>

I have same issue
More global note, you might need to use ngrok or a public to expose your OAuth URLs to the Internet or you might be stuck with an Epic Connectivity Fail.
I want all the private ones enabled too! lol
<@UD53A9UUR>;)
You are probably overcomplicating this
• The Webhook payload includes the `portalId` : The customer's portalId that this event came from
So you can just find the SaaS tenant by mapping their HubID from when they configged the integration to the info for that client on your side
Probably not the right set of OAuth scopes
Or the OAuth handshake and creds that it gives back are messed up and not getting sent in the requests
Can you be more specific
How frequently? And you need to configure a proper retry config in your REST client, or you will get 502 or 503 drama when HubSpot has code deploys or heavy load etc
I retry 502,503,504 and it works in my integration
You have to dump entire list out of properties and kick back to API in V3
That's just the way the cookie crumbles to speed up pageviews for Web UI people using it

custom obj's only few weeks old and requires high end license

not so many devs have used it yet so you are gonna have to do some deep digs
if you need crazy precise behavior of this you need to record your own times w/ a workflow, a few weeks ago somebody else had same issue and I sent same reply
can you dump out the payload? otherwise can't comment

did you try

<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/workflows/add_contact>
yeah it should be, did you see something weird
merry christmas
Nope, just wanted to check my understanding. Thanks for verifying <@U012W4YEUTX>
Thanks <@UCH1L597V> it works
